images.copyright: Prince Christian Sound in southern Greenland (© Posnov/Getty Images)
images.title: Southern tip of a northern isle
images.caption: Prince Christian Sound in southern Greenland
images.desc: The sheer size of Greenland is hard to put in perspective. The world's largest island is more than 836,000 square miles—that's more than three times the size of Texas and 170,000 square miles larger than Alaska. It is a land of deep fjords and thick ice that must have made the Norse explorers feel right at home when they landed there a thousand years ago.
images.bsTitle: Southern tip of a northern isle
